com.yantra.api.ypm.price

Interface getItemPrice

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    YIFApi, com.yantra.api.YPMApi

    public interface getItemPrice
    Computes unit price of line items.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getItemPrice(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The getItemPrice API computes the unit price and line price of each line item.

    • Method Detail

      • getItemPrice

        org.w3c.dom.Document getItemPrice(YFSEnvironment env,
                                  org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                           throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                  java.rmi.RemoteException

        The getItemPrice API computes the unit price and line price of each line item. ITEM_QUANTITY pricing rules are run on each line item if RUN_RULES_IN_CATALOG_PRICING rule is enabled.

        The processing logic of the getItemPrice API is as follows:

        1. Carry out input validations.
        2. Invoke the YPMGetItemPrice user exit where the unit price calculation can be implemented external to the system. If this user exit is implemented, then the API doesn't process further and returns the user exit output as the API output.
        3. Get the list of price list headers for the passed input criteria using getAssignedPricelistHeaderList API.
        4. Get the list of price list lines for the passed input criteria (like items, pricing date, etc..).
        5. Invoke the YPMPricelistLineSelection user exit. If implemented the user exit can filter out any price list lines based on which the unit price should not be derived.
        6. From the list of price list lines, for each line item in the input select the price list line which results in the lowest unit price.
        7. Calculate ExtendedPrice as UnitPrice times Quantity.
        8. If rule execution is enabled and rule execution in the input is not suppressed then
          • Load all the ITEM_QUANTITY rules that are assigned for the passed input criteria.
          • Evaluate all the loaded rules, to get list of line targeted actions. Perform these line targeted actions to generate adjustments under LineAdjustments element. These adjustments are summed up to LineAdjustment at each line item.
        9. Exclusivity Processing is performed to determine applicable pricing rules. Refer to getOrderPrice JavaDoc for details.
        10. For each line calculate LinePrice, which is sum of ExtendedPrice and LineAdjustment on that line.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: This API invokes the following user exits:

          com.yantra.ypm.japi.ue.YPMGetItemPriceUE
          com.yantra.ypm.japi.ue.YPMPricelistHeaderSelectionUE
          com.yantra.ypm.japi.ue.YPMPricelistLineSelectionUE
          com.yantra.ypm.japi.ue.YPMOverrideGetItemPriceUE
          com.yantra.ypm.japi.ue.YPMLoadCustomPricingRulesUE

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains prices for the items passed in input. Prices are not returned if there is no price configured for that item. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes. in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
